tag_to_content.title: Forum Ventures |  Early Stage Fund & B2B SaaS Startup Accelerator
tag_to_content.h1_0: Investing in Bold, Ambitious SaaS Founders
tag_to_content.div_3: We build with founders from creation to sustainable
tag_to_content.h2_0: How we build with SaaS founders like you
tag_to_content.p_0: Start, design and build your B2B SaaS company from scratch with a world class team
tag_to_content.p_1: Take your company from zero to sustainable with our industry leading accelerator
tag_to_content.p_2: Get Seed stage funding to grow and scale your business with our SaaS expertise
tag_to_content.h2_1: For SaaS Founders, By SaaS Founders
tag_to_content.p_3: Our team cut their teeth building early-stage SaaS companies of our own. We’re experts in GTM, early sales, and fundraising, passionate about helping founders build a sustainable business. 250 pre-seed & seed stage investments later, we know what it takes to build successful B2B SaaS startups.
tag_to_content.p_4: Fundraising is a process. Forum Ventures® has helped founders gain the confidence, skills and know-how to successfully raise their next round from top funds like A16z, Bessemer Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, CRV and hundreds more.

a_14.text: Here is how we can help

img_3.alt: At Forum, we’re more than capital & consultants, we’re confidants there for the highs and lows of the journey.

tag_to_content.p_5: At Forum, we’re more than capital & consultants, we’re confidants there for the highs and lows of the journey. When sh*t hits the fan, we’re here to fix it together, any hour of the day. And to get really excited with you when you land your first customer, secure an investor, and as tailwinds pick up.
tag_to_content.p_6: Getting support from a community of founders on a similar journey can make or break the success of a startup. In working with over 450 B2B SaaS founders, we’ve created one of the largest, most supportive and deeply connected communities in SaaS, with founders, mentors and experts who are always willing to lend a hand.
tag_to_content.h2_5: We’ve helped 450 SaaS founders raise capital from funds like A16z, Bessemer, and Backstage Capital through hands-on, end-to-end fundraising guidance and support.
tag_to_content.p_8: "We struggled at first to find a lead investor, and when we thought all hope was lost, Forum kept us optimistic and on track. 2 years later, we raised our Series A from Kleiner Perkins. And the first people we called to celebrate were the team at Forum."
tag_to_content.p_9: Emiel Bril, Founder & CEO of Vendor PM
tag_to_content.h2_6: We’ve helped hundreds of founders turn a rough idea into a winning product that their customers love via guidance on customer interviews, core feature sets, UX design, MVPs, and more.
tag_to_content.p_11: "Forum was the fractional cofounder that helped us refine our product, and calibrate our vision to resonate with the right investors to raise a Seed. With all the ups and downs in the early days, having the Forum team in our corner helped us keep up momentum and execute to the best of our ability."‍
tag_to_content.p_12: Sam Dundas, CoFounder & CEO, Bloom AI
tag_to_content.h2_7: We’ve made thousands of connections between founders, mentors, investors and corporates in our community through Orbiit, Slack, curated introductions, mentor matching, and more.
tag_to_content.p_14: "Forum believed in CoProcure from its very earliest days. During the program, I connected with and learned from a cohort of awesome founders, built relationships with Forum's mentor network, and learned how to tell our story to investors and candidates. The Forum team and broader founder community continues to be helpful to CoProcure today and is a go-to resource for me as I have questions."
tag_to_content.p_15: Mariel Reed, Cofounder & CEO of CoProcure
tag_to_content.h2_8: Securing early customers is essential for product development and finding market fit. We’ve introduced our portfolio founders to our community of Enterprise decision makers for pilots, proof of concepts, customers and more at companies like Microsoft, LPL Financial, and State Farm, to name a few.
tag_to_content.p_17: "Forum was a very valuable experience for us – they provided us with key customer introductions to companies in our target market that led to over $200K of revenue. Two months after demo day, we had grown revenue to $850K ARR and were able to close our seed round."
tag_to_content.p_18: Sean Thorne, CEO & Co-Founder, People Data Labs
tag_to_content.h2_9: We’ve helped hundreds of founders weather the emotional storm of starting a company by being available 24/7 with open minds, creating space for founders to tell the truth, and reminding them that they’re not the first or last to face this current challenge.
tag_to_content.p_20: "The real value comes from having Forum on your team– their perspective, energy, and support as you grow are worth the investment. Especially for first time founders who need someone to walk the journey with. I know in 4 years I can still call up Forum and they’ll talk me off the ledge, celebrate wins with me, help with a major decision, or simply jump on a sales call."
tag_to_content.p_21: Kory Kelly, CEO at Legal Karma
tag_to_content.div_7: Scalestack Raises $1 Million in First Funding Round
tag_to_content.div_8: PrivateAI and Vendor PM both selected as C100 2023 Fellows
tag_to_content.div_9: Deskree has raised a €1.4M Seed round to help developers create backend infrastructure without a single line of code
tag_to_content.p_22: “Who we choose to wire investments to can have a measurable impact on building an equitable tech ecosystem and on the broader economy."
tag_to_content.p_23: – Steph Jones, Head of D&I & Associate
tag_to_content.p_24: “We have the responsibility to educate the portfolio companies that we work with day in and day out how to build and foster a diverse team and inclusive culture.”
tag_to_content.p_26: “As venture capitalists, we have a platform to be able to create an outsized impact by reallocating capital to those that the industry has historically looked over.”
tag_to_content.p_28: “We certainly don’t have all of the answers but we won’t stop learning and improving because we understand how crucial it is to make this change.”
tag_to_content.p_30: “I truly believe that if the first 5-10 hires at a startup are from diverse backgrounds, that company will organically have a diverse workforce at scale.”

tag_to_content.title: Accelerator
tag_to_content.div_3: Everything you need on your B2B SaaS journey from zero to sustainable
tag_to_content.p_0: Starting a company is really hard – we understand that firsthand. As former SaaS founders and operators, we know the importance of having capital, support, and an outside perspective on this journey.When you join Forum Ventures®, you’ll have a fractional co-founder with differentiated world class expertise to help with product, GTM, and fundraising. You’ll feel supported and backed by a team and community at the most crucial of times. There are a lot of accelerator programs out there, but none go the extra mile like we do.
tag_to_content.h2_0: Personalized, hands-on support, wherever you are in the early founder journey
tag_to_content.p_1: Every company has different needs. We personalize our program, mentors, and expertise where you need it most to get you to where you need to be.
tag_to_content.p_2: Fundraising is a huge part of enabling company growth, but it’s often unchartered territory for founders. Our fundraising track is designed to get you to your next round of funding feeling ready and confident. Founders who raise with Forum Ventures do better than those who go it alone, because we guide you closely through the process from start to finish – bringing an investor mindset to every step.
tag_to_content.div_18: Advice & Best Practices from Our Community
tag_to_content.p_3: Your dedicated Managing Director will become an extension of your team, work with you day in day out, act as a sounding board, and ensure you’re always moving forward.

img_8.alt: Jonah Midanik, COO and Managing Partner

tag_to_content.div_22: Jonah Midanik, COO and Managing Partner
tag_to_content.p_4: An engineer by trade, Jonah has spent the last twenty years at the intersection of marketing and technology as a serial entrepreneur in Canada. Jonah has been lucky enough to have several different lenses on the founder journey from bootstrapping, to launching new corporate divisions, and raising 8 figures of venture capital. Jonah works hand in hand with founders preparing to fundraise, coaching them on their pitch, narrative, deck, and investor meetings.
tag_to_content.p_5: Derek Bugley is our most recent Managing Director to join Forum Ventures. He's a 3x B2B SaaS founder, having raised over $30 million in venture financing from the AI Fund, Sequoia, Techstars, and others. He specializes in early go-to-market strategies in highly technical markets and products. His last two startups focused on building AI tools for assessing the skillsets of organizations' talent. Having successfully sold to buying centers at Procter & Gamble, Coca-Cola, Pinterest, Lyft, and Delta, he is well-versed in both bottoms-up (PLG) and direct-to-enterprise approaches.
tag_to_content.div_27: GTM, Early Stage Sales, Customer Acquisition ‍
tag_to_content.p_6: Bocar works 1:1 with portfolio founders through the early stages of building, including go-to-market, founder-led sales, and fundraising. As part of the founding team of the Enterprise product at Hootsuite, Bocar helped the business grow to well over $150M+ and 2,000+ employees in under seven years. Bocar continues to co-found, advise, coach and angel invest in SaaS startups from pre-seed to Series A. Bocar is passionate about helping build and scale hyper growth SaaS companies.

img_11.alt: Jonah Midanik, COO and Managing Partner

tag_to_content.div_29: Fundraising, Revenue, Product Management, and Operations ‍
tag_to_content.p_7: Neal works alongside portfolio founders and supports their 0 to $1M ARR journey. Neal experienced this journey first-hand as the Co-Founder of First Resonance, a manufacturing SaaS business focused on unlocking the potential of the physical world. There, he raised $20M+ in venture funding, grew the team to 40+ employees, and had customers building complex hardware products like rockets and autonomous vehicles. Neal is an engineer by trade and he is passionate about the intersection of software, data, and hardware.
tag_to_content.div_30: Get access to over $100k worth of corporate perks, like Hubspot, Carta, Early Growth, and more, exclusive to founders in our community.
tag_to_content.div_31: Meet key customers from our network of 300+ F500 and F1000 companies to help drive early product feedback and revenue.
tag_to_content.h2_5: A Community of Alumni and SaaS Mentors
tag_to_content.div_32: Get matched with best-in-class operators, industry-leading executives, and seasoned founders for 1:1 mentorship.
tag_to_content.div_39: Senior Brand Strategist & Product Marketer @ Innovatemap
tag_to_content.h2_6: "Forum was a very valuable experience for us."
tag_to_content.div_41: “Forum was a very valuable experience for us. They provided us with key customer introductions to companies in our target market that led to over $200K of revenue. Two months after demo day, we had grown revenue to $850K ARR and were able to close our seed round.”
tag_to_content.p_8: People Data Labs enables companies to build innovative, trusted people data driven products at scale. Sean and his team joined our San Francisco program in August 2015 and we were the first check into the company. They have since gone on to raise close to $10M across a seed and Series A from funds like Susa Ventures, 8VC and Founders Fund.
tag_to_content.div_43: For more FAQs about the program and pitch process

a_14.text: How much do you invest in each company & what are your terms?

tag_to_content.h3_8: How much do you invest in each company & what are your terms?
tag_to_content.p_9: We provide $100k USD in pre seed funding to each company joining our program. We’re usually the first check in, and we write checks quickly (day 1 of the program), which founders truly appreciate. Our terms are $100k USD for 7.5% equity on a standard, post money SAFE.

a_15.text: What type of companies do you fund?

tag_to_content.h3_9: What type of companies do you fund?
tag_to_content.p_10: We fund B2B SaaS companies in any vertical in the early-stage (pre-seed) of your journey who have taken on less than $500k in funding, and have or are about to have an MVP in market.

a_16.text: What type of founders would be a good fit for Forum's program?

tag_to_content.h3_10: What type of founders would be a good fit for Forum's program?
tag_to_content.p_11: We love working with founders who are passionate about what they’re building, have strong founder-market fit, and are looking for a fractional co-founder to guide them and push them to the next stage. We work best with founders who are both driven and coachable.

a_17.text: What is your stance on Diversity & Inclusion?

tag_to_content.h3_11: What is your stance on Diversity & Inclusion?
tag_to_content.p_12: We believe we have a platform and the responsibility to make an outsized impact on the tech industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team, cohort, and community. We’re actively working on this by increasing diversity in our mentors, building educational modules to help our founders build out their own diverse and inclusive teams, and more.

a_18.text: How does the pitch process work?

tag_to_content.h3_12: How does the pitch process work?
tag_to_content.p_13: When you’re ready to apply, go ahead and fill out our pitch us form. We’ll then get back to you within 1-2 weeks on whether or not it makes sense to have a call with our team.

a_20.text: Do I need to be in one of your locations?

tag_to_content.h3_13: Do I need to be in one of your locations?
tag_to_content.p_14: While we have office space available in our three locations – Toronto, New York City, and San Francisco – we are happy to work with founders remotely, wherever they may reside. We also love to connect in person, so we encourage office visits when you can! We also host regular events for our founder community in each of our locations, and we'd love you to join us from time to time.

a_21.text: What does Forum provide, re: corporate discounts etc.?

tag_to_content.h3_14: What does Forum provide, re: corporate discounts etc.?
tag_to_content.p_15: We provide hundreds of business perks to our founders to help you scale your company in an affordable way. For example, 90% off your first year of Hubspot, or a free subscription to Carta for founders until they raise over $1M. It accumulates to over $100k of savings for each company and if we don't have the perk you're looking for, you can request it, and we'll try to get it for you!!
tag_to_content.div_45: They’re unique, ambitious, and resilient. Unwaveringly dedicated to their vision and obsessed with their business. Plus super authentic. Come get to know them.
tag_to_content.div_46: Felix Orwa is the Co-founder of Sote, the operating system for trade in Africa. Sote went on to raise a $3.6M Seed round. Felix is incredibly driven and ambitious; and has a big vision for the impact Sote can have on Africa.
tag_to_content.div_47: Oncue is a software and booking service for moving companies to make it easier for them to run their business from anywhere. Oncue joined our San Francisco program in Jan 2019 and we were the first check into the company. They have since gone on to raise $12M+ in funding across a seed and Series A round from funds like Bowery Capital, Crosslink Capital and Rethink Impact.
tag_to_content.div_48: Sam Udotong is the Co-founder & CTO of Fireflies.ai, an AI assistant for meetings that records and transcribes voice meetings. Sam manages a team that operates out of 5 continents and raised $5 million in seed funding.
tag_to_content.p_16: Our program is 4-months long and runs year round. You can join us anytime.
tag_to_content.div_59: Welcome to the Forum community! Look out for our welcome email soon. We'll keep in touch but we won't bombard you, we promise!

tag_to_content.p_0: Forum Ventures®, LLCPrivacy PolicyVersion 1.0Last revised on: April 13, 2023‍This Privacy Policy (the “Privacy Policy”) serves to inform you of our policies and procedures regarding the collection, use and disclosure of the information we receive when you access and use the website (the “Site”), services, software, content, and all other products and services (all of the foregoing collectively, the “Services”) owned, controlled or offered, directly or indirectly, by Forum Ventures®, LLC (together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, “Company”, “us”, “our”, and “we”). Company believes that the privacy of its users is paramount and strives to use Personal Information (as defined below) only in ways outlined in this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy is incorporated by reference into our Website Terms of Use, currently available at www.forumvc.com/terms-of-use (the “Terms”). Any terms used herein and not defined will have the meanings given to them in the Terms. By using the Services, you hereby warrant and represent that you have read, understand and agree to this Privacy Policy and the Terms and that you are over 18 years of age. PLEASE DO NOT USE, OR ACCESS THE SERVICES IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY. ‍Personal Information.  For purposes of this Privacy Policy, “Personal Information” means any information from or about a person that either identifies that person directly or that makes that person identifiable when it is combined with other information from or about that person from any source.‍Information We Collect ‍Information You Provide to Us.  When you use the Services or otherwise communicate with us, we collect information that you provide to us directly. For example, we collect information in the following circumstances: you (i) visit the Site, (ii) register for the Services or create an account or profile or accept the creation of an account or profile on your behalf (an “Account”), (iii) access the Services through social networking sites or third party services, (iii) subscribe to newsletters; (iv) purchase a product or service on the Site; (v) invite your friends to join the Services, “share” the Services on social networking sites or perform other similar actions; (vi) request technical support; (vii) otherwise use our online Services where Personal Information is required for such use and/or participation, and (ix) when you contact us via the Site or when you otherwise communicate with us. You can choose not to provide information that is requested of you by us; however, this may limit your ability to use or access the Services.  The information you provide to us directly may include, without limitation, the following information that may, alone or in combination with other date, constitute Personal Information:‍- Information you provide via email, through the “Pitch Us” section on the Site or by using the contact details listed on various parts of the Site, including your name, company name, e-mail address, phone number, inquire, and any other information you decide to provide;- Information you provide in order to subscribe to our newsletters and updates, including your email address, the topic for which you wish to receive updates, or any other information you decide to provide us with. You may always unsubscribe from these emails by following the instructions included; and- Any other information you may want to share with us, such as Personal Information you submit via out application forms for founders. Moreover, if you contact us, a record of such correspondence may be kept. ‍Automatically Collected Information.  Most of the data we collect in and through the Site and the Services is technical in nature and is collected and processed automatically through so-called application programming interfaces, software development kits, cookies and similar software-based technologies. Alone or in combination with other data, such automatically collected data may constitute Personal Information. The data we may collect by automated means may include, without limitation:‍- Usage data:  including, but not limited to search terms entered and pages viewed, and other aggregated data.- Network and internet information: including, but not limited to URLs, Internet Protocol addresses, use of spoofing, number of sessions initiated, and clickstreams.- Information we collect on the Site via cookies. Please see the “How We Use Cookies and Other Technologies” section below for more information.Google Analytics is an element of the Site. By using cookies, Google Analytics collects and stores data such as time of visit, pages visited, time spent on each page of the Site, the Internet Protocol address, and the type of operating system used in the devices used to access the Site. By using a browser plugin available at http://www.google.com/ads/preferences/plugin/ provided by Google, you can opt out of Google Analytics.‍Information You Share on Third Party Websites or Through Social Media Services.  The Services may include links to third party websites and social media services where you will be able to post comments, stories, reviews or other information. Your use of these third party websites and social media services may result in the collection or sharing of information about you by these third party websites and social media services. We encourage you to review the privacy policies and settings on the third party websites and social media services with which you interact to make sure you understand the information that may be collected, used, and shared by those third party websites and social media services.‍How We Use Cookies and Other Technologies.  Some of the features on the Site and the Services require the use of “cookies” which are small text files that are stored on your device’s hard drive. We use cookies to measure which pages are being accessed, and which features are most frequently used. This enables us to continuously improve the Site to meet the needs of our visitors.The following sets out how we may use different categories of cookies and your options for managing cookie settings:‍‍Required CookiesRequired cookies enable you to navigate the Site and use its features, such as accessing secure areas of the Site and using the Services. If you have chosen to identify yourself to us, we use cookies containing encrypted information to allow us to uniquely identify you. These cookies allow us to uniquely identify you when you are logged into the Site and to process your online requests. Because required cookies are essential to operate the Site, there is no option to opt out of these cookies.‍Performance CookiesThese cookies collect information about how you use our Sites, including which pages you go to most often and if they receive error messages from certain pages. These cookies do not collect information that individually identifies you. Information is only used to improve how the Site functions and performs. From time-to-time, we may engage third parties to track and analyze usage and volume statistical information relating to individuals who visit the Site. To learn how to opt out of performance cookies using your browser settings, click here. ‍Functionality CookiesFunctionality cookies allow the Site to remember information you have entered or choices you make (such as language, or region) and provide enhanced, more personal features. These cookies also enable you to optimize your use of the Site after logging in. These cookies can also be used to remember changes you have made to text size, fonts and other parts of web pages that you can customize. To learn how to opt out of functionality cookies using your browser settings, click here.‍Targeting or Advertising CookiesFrom time-to-time, we may engage third parties to track and analyze usage and volume statistical information from individuals who visit the Site. We may also use cookies delivered by third parties to track the performance of our advertisements. For example, these cookies remember which browsers have visited the Site. By way of example, as you browse the Site, advertising cookies may be placed on your computer so that we can understand what you are interested in. Our advertising partners then enable us to present you with retargeted advertising on other sites based on your previous interaction with the Site.To learn more about these and other advertising networks and their opt out instructions, click here.‍We and our service providers may also use “pixel tags,” “web beacons,” “clear GIFs,” or similar means in connection with the Services and HTML-formatted email messages to, among other things, track the actions of users, to determine the success of marketing campaigns and to compile aggregate statistics about Site usage and response rates. ‍Use of Collected Information.  We use the information you provide to use for the following purposes: (i) to further our legitimate interests in providing the Services, (ii) to administer your use of the Services, (iii) to personalize your experience, (iv) to provide to you Service announcements or inform you of new releases and features, (v) to provide you with further information and offers from us or third parties that we believe you may find useful or interesting, such as newsletters, marketing or promotional materials, (vi) to perform tasks on behalf of and according to instructions of a third party, such as third party service providers or our advertising partners, (vii) to enforce our Terms, (viii) comply with a legal requirement or process, including, but not limited to ,, civil and criminal subpoenas, court orders or other compulsory disclosures; (ix) to further our legitimate interest in protecting our rights, property, or safety and the rights, property and safety for the Services, our users or the public, and (x) to contact you to obtain feedback from you regarding the Site and the Services. In addition to the purposes described above, we use the information collected automatically to (a) further our legitimate interests in monitoring and analyzing the use of the Services and for the technical administration of the Site, (b) improve the Site and Services, (c) generate and derive useful data and information concerning the interests, characteristics and website use behavior of our users, and (d) verify that users of the Services meet the criteria required to process their requests. We and or our advertising partners may use demographic and geo-location, as well as information logged from your hardware or device, including data such as Internet Protocol address, operating system, application usage data, device time zone, region and language, and click ID, to ensure relevant advertising is presented with the Services.‍Third Parties We Share Personal Information With.   We may disclose Personal Information you provide to use or that we collect automatically on the Site and in and through the Services with the following categories of third parties:‍- Service providers, such as web hosting, data storage service providers, marketing service providers, and communications service providers;- Public authorities, such as law enforcement, if we are legally required to do so or if we need to protect our rights or the rights of third parties; and- Our subsidiaries and affiliates; or a subsequent owner, co-owner or operator of the Site and/or Services and their advisors in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, restructuring, the sale of substantially all of our ownership interests and/or assets, or in connection with bankruptcy proceedings, or other corporate reorganization, in accordance with this Privacy Policy.‍Links to Other Websites.  We frequently make content or services from other websites available to you from links located on the Site. We may present links in a format that enables us to keep track of whether these links have been followed. This Privacy Policy applies only to the Site and the Services. We do not exercise control over third party services or other websites that provide information, or links from within the Site or the Services. Your interactions with these third party services are governed by the privacy policy of the company providing it. These other sites and services may place their own cookies or other files on your computer and your computer’s browser, collect data or solicit Personal Information from you. Other websites and services follow different rules regarding the use or disclosure of the Personal Information that you submit, and the collection and use of such information and access of any third party websites are subject to such third party’s privacy policy. We encourage you to read the privacy policies and other terms of such third parties before using their services. ‍Security.  We understand the importance of privacy and security of Personal Information to our users and have made them a priority. We have implemented measures to help protect Personal Information from loss, misuse or unauthorized access or disclosure. While we strive to protect Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its security. ‍Vulnerability Reporting.  If you believe you have found a vulnerability or security concern with the Site, please submit a report to hello@forumvc.com. Please include the type of issue, a proof of concept and the detailed steps required to reproduce the issue. We take all disclosures very seriously. ‍Do Not Track Signals and Similar Mechanisms.  Some web browsers transmit “do-not-track” signals to websites. Because of differences in how web browsers incorporate and activate this feature, it is not always clear whether users intend for these signals to be transmitted. Or whether they are aware of them. We currently do not take action in response to these signals. Managing Your Privacy.   We keep your data on your behalf and for your benefit. You can correct or terminate and delete your information by following the instructions on the Services or by e-mail at hello@forumvc.com, which you may also access for further assistance and questions regarding the Privacy Policy or for a copy of your data.‍California Residents. Shine the Light Disclosure.  California Civil Code Section 1798.83 requires certain business that share customer Personal Information with third parties for the third parties’ direct marketing purposes to respond to requests from California users asking about the businesses’ practices related to such information sharing. We currently do not share or disclose your Personal Information to third parties for the third parties’ direct marketing purposes. If we change our practices in the future, we will implement an opt-out policy as required under California laws.   ‍Requests to Know.  California residents have the right to request that we disclose:- The categories of Personal Information we have collected about you;The categories of Personal Information about you we have sold or disclosed for a business purpose;- The categories of sources from which we have collected Personal Information about you;- The business or commercial purposes for selling or collecting Personal Information about you;- The categories of Personal Information sold or shared, if any, about you, as well as the categories of third parties to whom the Personal Information was sold, by category of Personal Information for each party to whom Personal Information was sold; and - The specific pieces of Personal Information collected.You may submit a request to know via hello@forumvc.com. The delivery of our response may take place electronically or by mail. We are not required to respond to requests to know more than twice in a 12-month period.We do not sell, and have not in the prior 12 months sold, Personal Information about California residents. Therefore, we have not included a “Do Not Sell My Personal Info” link on our Site. If our practices change, we will update this Privacy Policy and take any other necessary action to comply with applicable law. We do, however, disclose Personal Information for business purposes as described in the “Third Parties We Share Personal Information With” section above. ‍Requests to Delete. You have the right to request that we delete any Personal Information about you that we have collected. Upon receiving a verified request to delete Personal Information, we will do so unless otherwise required or authorized by law. You may submit a request to delete Personal Information via hello@forumvc.com.‍Authorized Agents.  You may designate an authorized agent to make requests on your behalf. You must provide an authorized agent written permission to submit a request on your behalf, and we may require that you verify your identity directly with us. Alternatively, an authorized agent that has been provided power of attorney pursuant to Probate Code sections 4000-4465 may submit a request on your behalf. ‍Methods for Submitting Consumer Requests and Our Response to Requests. You may submit a request know and requests to delete Personal Information about you via:hello@forumvc.com‍Upon receipt of a request, we may ask you for additional information to verify your identity. Any additional information you provide will be used only to verify your identity and not for any other purpose.‍We will acknowledge the receipt of your request within 10 days of receipt. Subject to our ability to verify your identity, we will respond to your request within 45 days of receipt. If we require more time (up to 90 days), we will inform you of the reason and extension period in writing.‍Any disclosures we provide will only cover the 12-month period preceding the verifiable consumer request’s receipt. The response we provide will also explain the reasons we cannot comply with a request, if applicable.‍We do not charge a fee to process or respond to your verifiable consumer request unless it is excessive, repetitive, or manifestly unfounded. If we determine that the request warrants a fee, we will tell you why we made that decision and provide you with a cost estimate before completing your request.‍The Right to Non-Discrimination.  You have the right not to be discriminated against for the exercise of your California privacy rights described above. This Privacy Policy might change as we update and expand the Services. You can tell when this Privacy Policy was last updated by reviewing the “Last Revised On” legend on the top of this page. We will endeavor to notify you of these changes by email, but will not be liable for any failure to do so. We also encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically. Your continued use of the Services after any change in this Privacy Policy will constitute your acceptance of such change.‍Contacting Us: If you have any concerns or questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at hello@forumvc.com.

tag_to_content.div_94: No, not that kind of text... ‍ As a founder, there are moments when you feel like everything is falling apart. Maybe you're running out of money, or you've lost your only customer. Perhaps your product isn't working, and you're doubting yourself for faking it through the day. That's where we come in. We're your confidants, with open hearts and open minds. Share your fears, your f**k-ups, and we'll work through it together. We'll share the responses to some of the most vulnerable questions we get from founders.

tag_to_content.title: Forum Studio | Where founders create the best new B2B SaaS companies
tag_to_content.h2_0: Go from concept to launch with less risk in record time
tag_to_content.div_1: Our venture studio pairs our seasoned team of B2B SaaS and AI experts with world-class founders like you to provide them with funding and support to create successful venture-scalable companies.
tag_to_content.p_0: Venture studios provide a more holistic approach to helping entrepreneurs build and launch their businesses by providing entrepreneurs with a range of services and support, from idea validation to product design and development. They also offer invaluable mentorship, guidance, and resources to help entrepreneurs transform their ideas into successful AI businesses. Forum launched our venture studio in 2022 to support founders even earlier in their journey while having fractional ownership in the latest technology transforming how we live, work, and interact. We’re dedicated to helping entrepreneurs build successful businesses from the ground up. We act as fractional co-founders, providing entrepreneurs with the resources to launch and scale their businesses. ‍
tag_to_content.p_1: A Call for FoundersA great AI SaaS founder has the drive and a commitment to solving a problem that plagues themselves and peers in their industry from thriving. They approach “there MUST be a better way” by throwing spaghetti at the wall to see what sticks. They envision how tech can enable the world to operate better and jump out of the box instead of being content with the ways things are. We are looking for founders with deep domain experience – not pedigree. Whether you have your own concept or are an early-stage rockstar and professional brainstormer, we’re looking for founders to build the tech solutions of tomorrow.
tag_to_content.div_2: We can write your code, design your product and create sales materials. We have a team of seasoned SaaS experts who will build alongside you across development, UI/UX, growth and business design.
tag_to_content.div_3: : We invest $250K USD into each startup we launch and an end-to-end fundraising playbook and network to raise your seed and Series A. We have an extremely strong vested interest in your success, so expect your inbox to be flooded with investor intros when the time comes.
tag_to_content.div_4: including our network of customers, mentors, and investors, a community of other founders, $100k+ worth of software discounts and credits, and much more!
tag_to_content.strong_2: All the benefits of being a Forum company
tag_to_content.div_5: , Forum's venture studio employs a hands-on approach to accelerate the growth of AI-focused startups. Our expertise lies in identifying disruptive AI technologies, fine-tuning business models, and driving rapid growth to transform innovative ideas into venture-scalable companies.
tag_to_content.strong_3: Extensive experience in B2B SaaS and AI

img_2.alt: We’re Looking For Ambitious Folks That…

tag_to_content.h2_2: Get 1% in the next B2B Tech Unicorn
tag_to_content.p_2: We are looking for innovative business ideas to transform industries such as HealthTech, Supply Chain Tech, GenAI, and more! You don’t need an MVP, a co-founder, or even a company to pitch us – just an idea.
tag_to_content.h2_3: Everything You Need to Start, Build & Win in AI
tag_to_content.p_12: Our team works with founders to rapidly validate ideas and build pilots. We talk to customers, test potential solutions, and collect feedback. We seek market validation for every angle until we get to a pilot.
tag_to_content.p_14: After a successful pilot, we build the MVP, expand the team, and develop a sales, marketing, and GTM strategy to hit a target ARR. With the full package, we enter Investor Week to raise your next round.
tag_to_content.p_16: As you grow, we stay on as board members and observers. You have unlimited access to our communities and enjoy the strength of customer intros, GTM expertise, and a funding network to drive growth.
tag_to_content.p_18: Building a company from the ground up requires support to bring it to life. From Day 1, you will have a team of unparalleled experts in building and scaling winning B2B SaaS companies by your side.
tag_to_content.p_20: The toughest part of moving fast is hiring the right people. On our platform, you’ll have a dedicated recruitment partner and access to our pipeline of diverse talent and advisors.
tag_to_content.p_22: Join us to build companies that solve the problems you care deeply about. Create a meaningful impact for generations to come.
tag_to_content.h2_4: We’re Looking For Ambitious Folks That…
tag_to_content.div_6: Have deep industry experience and connections
tag_to_content.div_7: Have a strong POV on what a market is missing or an unmet customer need
tag_to_content.div_8: Are passionate about building in the AI space and using AI to solve key industry challenges
tag_to_content.div_9: Bonus: Have a phenomenal idea born from direct domain or personal experience
tag_to_content.div_10: Bonus: Have founded a company before or were an early builder at a startup

img_11.alt: We’re Looking For Ambitious Folks That…

tag_to_content.div_12: Within legacy markets that are ripe for disruption
tag_to_content.div_13: In categories that don’t have a clear winner yet
tag_to_content.div_14: For groups that have traditionally been underserved and overlooked
tag_to_content.div_15: Companies with clear purpose at their center
tag_to_content.div_16: Across all industries! Some that we love / have built in include supply chain, vertical Saas, fintech, healthcare, and the future of work, but we are open to all. See our portfolio
tag_to_content.p_23: We’ve deliberately stacked our Venture Studio team with the experience and know-how to conceive, build and scale SaaS companies from scratch. Our studio team consists of researchers, product leaders, marketers, engineers, and operators ready to start the journey with you.
tag_to_content.h2_7: Start an AI Company with Purpose and Passion
tag_to_content.p_24: Founders who build with Forum’s Venture Studio are more likely to get to Series A and generate returns. Come with an idea, a problem or desire and let’s create the next big SaaS company together.
tag_to_content.div_50: Welcome to the Forum community! Look out for our welcome email soon. We'll keep in touch but we won't bombard you, we promise!

tag_to_content.title: Forum Seed | Seed Funding for B2B SaaS Startups
tag_to_content.div_3: Funding, Support & Community from Seed to Series A
tag_to_content.p_0: Every industry is going through a major digital transformation, providing incredible opportunities for founders to shape the future.Forum Ventures'® Seed fund backs and supports ambitious B2B founders on their journey from Seed to Series A, enabling them to drive innovation across industries and build massive businesses in the process. Our platform and team of early operators from our accelerator enables us to provide more hands-on help than any other seed fund out there.
tag_to_content.h2_0: Community, support, and infrastructure at your fingertips
tag_to_content.div_4: In-house specialized consulting on GTM, sales, marketing, HR, and more
tag_to_content.div_5: Hand in hand fundraising support for your Series A raise.
tag_to_content.div_6: Customer introductions to our network of 100s of C-level innovation leaders.
tag_to_content.div_7: An active SaaS founder community of 500+ portfolio founders at all stages
tag_to_content.div_8: Content & programming you can’t get at any other Seed Fund.
tag_to_content.div_9: Access to $100k in savings a year with our founder perks program
tag_to_content.h2_1: "We would not be here if it weren't for Forum.
tag_to_content.div_10: There are a lot of early stage funds that can write checks, but few go the extra mile like I have witnessed the Forum team do. The personalized, extension-of-team approach makes you feel supported at the most crucial of times. Forum was always my first call when times were tough and when there was something big to celebrate, no matter the time of day or night.”
tag_to_content.p_1: Emiel joined our program in Toronto in January 2020. We were the first check into VendorPM. During the program, we saw early signs of product market fit and a founder who showed a relentless drive to build a big business. In August 2020, we wrote a follow on check out of our seed fund, co investing with Mucker Capital. Less than 9 months later, revenue grew over 10X, with another round coming together as we speak!

tag_to_content.p_2: Get Seed stage funding to grow and scale your business with our SaaS expertise
tag_to_content.h2_1: For SaaS Founders, By SaaS Founders
tag_to_content.p_3: Our team cut their teeth building early-stage SaaS companies of our own. Weâre experts in GTM, early sales, and fundraising, passionate about helping founders build a sustainable business. 250 pre-seed & seed stage investments later, we know what it takes to build successful B2B SaaS startups.
tag_to_content.p_4: Fundraising is a process. Forum VenturesÂ® has helped founders gain the confidence, skills and know-how to successfully raise their next round from top funds like A16z, Bessemer Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, CRV and hundreds more.

a_14.text: Here is how we can help

img_3.alt: At Forum, weâre more than capital & consultants, weâre confidants there for the highs and lows of the journey.

tag_to_content.p_5: At Forum, weâre more than capital & consultants, weâre confidants there for the highs and lows of the journey. When sh*t hits the fan, weâre here to fix it together, any hour of the day. And to get really excited with you when you land your first customer, secure an investor, and as tailwinds pick up.
tag_to_content.p_6: Getting support from a community of founders on a similar journey can make or break the success of a startup. In working with over 450 B2B SaaS founders, weâve created one of the largest, most supportive and deeply connected communities in SaaS, with founders, mentors and experts who are always willing to lend a hand.
tag_to_content.h2_5: Weâve helped 450 SaaS founders raise capital from funds like A16z, Bessemer, and Backstage Capital through hands-on, end-to-end fundraising guidance and support.Â
tag_to_content.p_8: "We struggled at first to find a lead investor, and when we thought all hope was lost, Forum kept us optimistic and on track. 2 years later, we raised our Series A from Kleiner Perkins. And the first people we called to celebrate were the team at Forum."
tag_to_content.p_9: Emiel Bril, Founder & CEO of Vendor PM
tag_to_content.h2_6: Weâve helped hundreds of founders turn a rough idea into a winning product that their customers love via guidance on customer interviews, core feature sets, UX design, MVPs, and more.
tag_to_content.p_11: "Forum was the fractional cofounder that helped us refine our product, and calibrate our vision to resonate with the right investors to raise a Seed. With all the ups and downs in the early days, having the Forum team in our corner helped us keep up momentum and execute to the best of our ability."â
tag_to_content.p_12: Sam Dundas, CoFounder & CEO, Bloom AI
tag_to_content.h2_7: Weâve made thousands of connections between founders, mentors, investors and corporates in our community through Orbiit, Slack, curated introductions, mentor matching, and more.
tag_to_content.p_14: "Forum believed in CoProcure from its very earliest days. During the program, I connected with and learned from a cohort of awesome founders, built relationships with Forum's mentor network, and learned how to tell our story to investors and candidates. The Forum team and broader founder community continues to be helpful to CoProcure today and is a go-to resource for me as I have questions."
tag_to_content.p_15: Mariel Reed, Cofounder & CEO of CoProcure
tag_to_content.h2_8: Securing early customers is essential for product development and finding market fit. Weâve introduced our portfolio founders to our community of Enterprise decision makers for pilots, proof of concepts, customers and more at companies like Microsoft, LPL Financial, and State Farm, to name a few.
tag_to_content.p_17: "Forum was a very valuable experience for us â they provided us with key customer introductions to companies in our target market that led to over $200K of revenue. Two months after demo day, we had grown revenue to $850K ARR and were able to close our seed round."
tag_to_content.p_18: Sean Thorne, CEO & Co-Founder, People Data Labs
tag_to_content.h2_9: Weâve helped hundreds of founders weather the emotional storm of starting a company by being available 24/7 with open minds, creating space for founders to tell the truth, and reminding them that theyâre not the first or last to face this current challenge.
tag_to_content.p_20: "The real value comes from having Forum on your teamâ their perspective, energy, and support as you grow are worth the investment. Especially for first time founders who need someone to walk the journey with. I know in 4 years I can still call up Forum and theyâll talk me off the ledge, celebrate wins with me, help with a major decision, or simply jump on a sales call."
tag_to_content.p_21: Kory Kelly, CEO at Legal Karma

tag_to_content.title: Forum Ventures | Our Team and Company Values
tag_to_content.p_0: Forum Ventures® was started from a place of helpfulness, with the mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible and successful for early-stage founders. We invest in early-stage SaaS founders first, and their companies second. We treat our community with immense respect, integrity, honesty, and inclusivity. We are humbled daily – we know we don’t know it all – and we stay open to learning, to different and new ideas, and to growing together. We're passionate about helping founders and we mean it when we say founders come first.
tag_to_content.h2_0: We’re ex SaaS founders, operators, and early builders, ready to lend expertise, give honest feedback, and celebrate your wins together.
tag_to_content.p_1: Michael Cardamone was one of the first 30 employees at Box in a BD role and then led partnerships at AcademixDirect. After 6 years in operating roles, he launched Forum Ventures. He is also an angel investor a dozen companies, including in the seed round of Flexport.
tag_to_content.p_2: Taylor Walker is our Head of People where she helps build and support our team with the resources necessary to stay engaged and healthy. She works with our portfolio founders building talent and HR strategy, as well as operations support. Previous to Forum, Taylor built out people and talent functions at Atomic VC Canada, and SaaS scaleup, Auvik Networks.
tag_to_content.p_3: Olivia O’Sullivan is a Partner at Forum Ventures. She builds communities, connections and resources that help early-stage founders go from zero to sustainable. Olivia joined Forum Ventures from Dow Jones where she managed Product & Innovation Strategy.
tag_to_content.p_4: Dani is focused on supporting our founders and their surrounding ecosystem to ensure the Forum community is connected and thriving. Prior to joining Forum, Daniela was an operator in ed-tech start-ups
tag_to_content.p_6: James Murphy is Forum’s General Partner, and was the Co-Founder of Robly, a marketing automation platform based in New York City. James is an active angel investor and advisor to numerous early stage SaaS startups.
tag_to_content.p_7: Jonah Midanik has spent the last twenty years at the intersection of marketing and technology as a serial entrepreneur in Canada. Jonah has been lucky enough to have several different lenses on the founder journey from bootstrapping, to launching new corporate divisions, and raising 8 figures of venture capital.
tag_to_content.p_8: Bocar sits at the intersection of investing and working 1:1 with portfolio founders through the early stages of building, including go-to-market, founder-led sales, and fundraising. As part of the founding team of the Enterprise product at Hootsuite, Bocar helped the business grow to over $150M+ and 2,000+ employees in under seven years.
tag_to_content.div_34: Global Commercial Head of Shipping & Fulfillment at Shopify
tag_to_content.p_9: Maia works with SaaS founders from inception to scale.  She has spent over 20 years founding, building and scaling award-winning SaaS products for Entrepreneurs and SMBs at places like LexisNexis, Pitney Bowes and most recently at Shopify, where she helped found, launch and scale their Shipping and Fulfillment products from inception to 60%+ merchant adoption and $Bs of transportation spend.
tag_to_content.p_11: Derek Bugley is a 3x B2B SaaS founder, having raised over $30 million in venture financing from the AI Fund, Sequoia, Techstars, and others. He specializes in early go-to-market strategies in highly technical markets and products. His last two startups focused on building AI tools for assessing the skillsets of organizations' talent. Having successfully sold to buying centers at Procter & Gamble, Coca-Cola, Pinterest, Lyft, and Delta, he is well-versed in both bottoms-up (PLG) and direct-to-enterprise approaches.
tag_to_content.p_12: Alexis Clarfield-Henry is a B2B SaaS marketing specialist who spent 12+ years in the advertising industry before joining Unata, a Toronto-based B2B tech startup, as an early employee and the first marketer.
tag_to_content.p_13: Paulina focuses on building and nurturing our investor community in order to make the best possible matches between investors and our portfolio companies. Paulina joins us from Microsoft, where she spent the last 2+ years leading community, investor and partnership initiatives for the Microsoft for Startups Program.
tag_to_content.div_50: Venture Capital and Growth Equity Investing at Georgian
tag_to_content.p_14: David is an Investor at Forum Ventures and focuses on sourcing, evaluating, and executing investment opportunities for the firm. He enjoys surfacing incredible SaaS businesses in the earliest stages of their development and partnering with them to help accelerate their growth. He brings over 5 years of experience in the software investment, market research, and management consulting space.
tag_to_content.div_54: Business designer and strategist in a venture studio
tag_to_content.p_15: Alice leads the process of transforming concepts into companies by designing and validating solutions and helping our founders translate insights into product. Prior to joining Forum, Alice was a business designer and strategist in a venture studio.
tag_to_content.p_16: Sid is helping launch and grow B2B startups. Prior to joining Forum, Sid was the founder of Broca, an AI SaaS startup. He has also consulted for and led growth at dozens of early-stage SaaS startups. He has a passion for all things AI and technology.
tag_to_content.p_17: Neal Sarraf is a Managing Director and Partner at Forum Ventures. He focuses on pre-seed and seed investments and works alongside portfolio founders, supporting their 0 to $1M ARR journey. Neal experienced this journey first-hand as the Co-Founder of First Resonance, a manufacturing SaaS business where he raised $20M+ in venture funding and grew the team to 40+ employees.
tag_to_content.div_66: Creative Director at Creative Capital Design Studio
tag_to_content.p_18: Teija is Forum Studio’s Head of Design. She is a storyteller focused on creative direction, brand, web and product design for the tech industry for the last decade. Teija has worked in the corporate world of Capital Markets Technology, led and managed teams, and served as Partner and Creative Director at a boutique full-service design agency in Toronto.
tag_to_content.p_19: As Head of Technology, Karthik is responsible for turning ideas into useable concepts. Karthik has over 2 decades of product engineering experience in the Tech sector. Prior to Forum, Karthik served as the VP of Engineering at Zuva.ai and over the past two decades, he has been a co-founder at Pixibo and a Full Stack Engineer at Getty Images, Travelocity to name a few.
tag_to_content.p_20: Naomi Goez is an Investor at Forum Ventures who is focused on deal origination, evaluation, and execution. She is a former supply chain operator who began her career in the fashion industry, managing Western Hemisphere production and sustainability initiatives at Centric Brands, and later navigating the fundraising process at a pre-seed stage circular brand. She received her MBA at The Wharton School, while working as an MBA Associate at Alpaca VC, and is passionate about promoting diversity in the ecosystem as well as supporting underrepresented founders and investors alike.
tag_to_content.div_77: B2B Marketing at a Boutique Consultancy
tag_to_content.p_21: Maggie is a B2B marketing professional with experience in fast-growing companies, developing and implementing integrated marketing plans to drive awareness, acquisition, and leads. Maggie will be working to reach and attract the best early-stage SaaS founders in the world.
tag_to_content.p_22: Nia supports founders by building and activating our Alumni network of 500+ founders, as well as our communities of mentors, corporate innovators, partners, operators and more.
tag_to_content.p_24: Navid joins us from Goodwin where he was an Associate on their Venture Capital and Startup team. He brings great experience working with both startups and VC funds at one of the most reputable law firms in the industry.
tag_to_content.div_87: Head of Talent and Recruitment, Studio
tag_to_content.p_25: Carmen joins Forum Studio’s Talent team to focus on founder recruitment and early-stage hiring strategy and execution. She has spent the last 10 years building relationships in talent acquisition and customer success.
tag_to_content.p_26: Dallas is helping launch and grow B2B startups. Prior to joining Forum Dallas was leading early-stage programs at Co.Labs a Saskatchewan-based incubator helping founders go from idea to revenue. He is also a Co-Founder of Leo Prestte, a brand and content design agency.
tag_to_content.p_28: As a Venture Analyst, Alejandro plays a part in initiating, identifying, and assessing prospective investment opportunities. Before joining the Forum team, he served as a junior investment analyst at BDC Capital's Seed and IT Venture Fund, and working with Fidelity Investments. Moreover, Alejandro offers distinct insights of a founder, having co-founded a venture, Viable Ads.
tag_to_content.p_29: Ammar comes from a background of innovation and ideation. Prior to joining Forum's Studio, he was the Director of Idea Lab at Magnet Forensics and prior to that the Technical Lead at Sonova Innovation Lab. In both roles he led teams in exploring and validating novel concepts, transforming them into successful and impactful solutions.
tag_to_content.p_30: Waun Broderick is a Technical Lead and full-stack developer at The Forum Venture's Studio Team, where he designs and builds B2B SaaS Products. Prior to joining Forum Ventures Waun worked in a breadth of diverse organizations; from North America's largest Tech Incubator, to the Canadian government's Top-Secret intelligence agency. He was also the co-founder of a SaaS company that scaled two products across North America, and a technology consulting organization. He has a passion for technology and designing pragmatic solutions that utilize AI to deliver real value to his clients
tag_to_content.p_32: Ellie Bof, joins us after 13 years leading Accounting and Operations at Canadian Iceberg Vodka Corporation, bringing a wealth of finance best practices, knowledge and experience from an equally highly regulated industry to Forum.
tag_to_content.p_33: Alex leads the development of several initiatives to support the broader investment team. Most recently, Alex was a software engineer at Hive, and before that, he worked in sales at People Data Labs. Alex has a B.S. in Business from the University of Southern California.
tag_to_content.p_34: Joe is a Product Designer in Forum’s Studio. Prior to joining Forum, he worked in a variety of design fields. He started his career in Advertising as an Art Director for many years and then moved into the Interior Design field, where he had his own design firm. Wanting to combine his passion for tech with design, Joe has most recently pivoted his focus to Product Design.
tag_to_content.div_128: Multi-time VP of Sales and Sales consultant
tag_to_content.p_35: Whitney Sales has helped startups grow for 15+ years and is considered an expert in entrepreneurial selling and building early-stage sales teams. She is the creator of The Sales Method, a systematic process to help startups identify their target markets, launch products to market and scale sales quickly and successfully.
tag_to_content.p_37: We work hard, but more importantly, we love to have fun, connect, and collaborate together!
tag_to_content.h2_33: Backed by World Class SaaS Founders and Executives
tag_to_content.div_136: We believe that regardless of background or circumstance, founders should be able to get access to funding, build their dreams, and push the world forward. We’re focused on building and activating a SaaS community that is truly inclusive, diverse, and supportive of founders.
tag_to_content.div_137: “Who we choose to wire investments to can have a measurable impact on building an equitable tech ecosystem and on the broader economy.”
tag_to_content.div_138: – Steph Jones, Head of D&I & Associate
tag_to_content.div_139: “We have the responsibility to educate the portfolio companies that we work with day in and day out how to build and foster a diverse team and inclusive culture.”
tag_to_content.div_141: “As venture capitalists, we have a platform to be able to create an outsized impact by reallocating capital to those that the industry has historically looked over.”
tag_to_content.div_143: “It’s not enough to hire diverse talent, we need to make sure they are comfortable, empowered, and can flourish on our team.”
tag_to_content.div_145: “We certainly don’t have all of the answers but we won’t stop learning and improving because we understand how crucial it is to make this change.”
tag_to_content.div_147: “I truly believe that if the first 5-10 hires at a startup are from diverse backgrounds, that company will organically have a diverse workforce at scale.”
tag_to_content.div_149: “We know that the venture capital and startup landscape is inherently flawed when it comes to diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity. As both a startup program and fund, we’re in a unique position to influence the future of the tech industry.”
tag_to_content.div_151: “We’re committed to doing our part from our corner of the world by increasing diversity within our team, our funding practices, our program content, and our community at large.”

tag_to_content.div_153: Learn why DE&I is important at Forum
tag_to_content.h3_6: A few of our ambitious, diverse portfolio founders
tag_to_content.div_154: Kathleen is the Founder and CEO of Calico, the product development OS that powers the $1.4 trillion eCommerce production market from concept to doorstep. A serial founder, Kathleen previously started two D2C brands and grew them from zero to six figures in revenues in the first six months of operations. Prior to Calico, Kathleen was was the youngest professor at Centennial College in Toronto and ran national marketing campaigns at Microsoft Canada.
tag_to_content.div_155: Ariel is the founder of Knac, a data driven talent evaluation platform that helps companies not overlook candidates. A career coach, entrepreneur, and public speaker with almost a decade of recruiting experience, Ariel has helped some of the biggest brands in the world build great teams; and has worked with thousands of marketing, advertising, and tech professionals to help them grow in their careers and find lucrative opportunities.
tag_to_content.div_156: Chinwe is the Co-founder & CEO of PocketSuite, an all-in-one app that helps anyone start and run a business within 15 minutes. Chinwe is a third time founder, previously co-founding Fundwell and O-H Community Partners. Prior to that Chinwe spent time leading a global team as President of Great Place to Work as well as consulting with Fortune 500 Companies at McKinsey and Monitor Group.
tag_to_content.div_157: Know a great underrepresented SaaS founder or rockstar? We want to grow our diverse community of founders, mentors, speakers and advisors and would appreciate the introduction.

tag_to_content.title: The Forum Portfolio | The Tech Startups Transforming SaaS
tag_to_content.div_4: How we work is changing rapidly, from how companies hire and engage with talent, to how automation and robotics is changing jobs and skills, to how remote work solutions are changing how we connect and collaborate from afar. We are excited to back the companies that will help shape a more productive, flexible and inclusive future.
tag_to_content.div_6: Chris joined our NYC cohort in early 2020. His company, FirstBase, provides remote worker setup for companies. FirstBase raised a $2M round at the end of our program and with sales skyrocketing, raised a $13M Series A led by Andreessen Horowitz only 9 months later. And within 2 years of joining Forum, they raised a $50M Series B led by Kleiner Perkins.
tag_to_content.div_7: Fireflies.ai is an AI assistant for meetings that records and transcribes voice meetings. Co-founders Krish and Sam joined our San Francisco program in July 2017. Today, their team operates out of 5 continents. They raised $5M in seed funding in late 2019 led by Canaan Partners, and in 2021 raised a $14M Series A led by Khosla Ventures.
tag_to_content.div_8: Indio is an insurance technology platform that’s setting out to “modernize” the insurance application and renewal process. Indio joined our San Francisco program in 2017 and in 2019 they raised their $20M Series B led by Menlo Ventures, with participation from 8VC. Indio was acquired in 2020 by Applied Systems.
tag_to_content.div_9: Oncue is a software and booking service for moving companies to make it easier for them to run their business from anywhere. Oncue joined our San Francisco program in Jan 2019 and we were the first check into the company. They have since gone on to raise $12M+ in funding across a seed and Series A round from funds like Bowery Capital, Crosslink Capital and Rethink Impact.
tag_to_content.div_11: The digitization of every industry is upon us and there will be massive opportunity for founders with a unique perspective on how to drive change within a specific vertical. We've backed vertical SaaS companies across Healthcare, Real Estate, Construction, Transportation, HR, Financial Services, Insurance, Government, Airports, Restaurants and many more.
tag_to_content.div_14: Companies like Stripe and Twilio have paved the way for the massive growth we will continue to see for API first companies and products that enable core functionality for applications.
tag_to_content.div_16: Troy Goode is the founder of Courier, the fastest way for developers to add notifications to their app. Troy has been a long time mentor for Forum Ventures and was previously the CTO & Head of Product at Winmore. Forum invested in Courier’s seed round alongside Matrix Partners, YC and SaaS Venture Capital. Just 6 months later, Courier raised a $10M Series A led by Bessemer Venture Partners. In 2022 they raised their $35M Series B led by GV.
tag_to_content.div_17: People Data Labs enables companies to build innovative, trusted people data driven products at scale. Sean and his team joined our San Francisco program in August 2015 and we were the first check into the company. They have since gone on to raise more than $55M across a seed, Series A and Series B from funds including Susa Ventures, Craft Ventures, 8VC and Founders Fund.
tag_to_content.div_18: Roots Automation is a cognitive process automation company that enables companies to add Digital Coworkers. Chaz was the CTO at AIG and John was the Automation Center of Excellence Lead at AIG. After seeing first hand how hard it was to implement RPA, they left to start Roots Automation and joined our NYC program in January 2020. They then went on to raise $11M in Seed funding from Vestigo Ventures, Right Side Capital, and Gutbrain Ventures.
tag_to_content.div_19: InscribeAI is building an API to enable companies to detect fraudulent documents for things like loan applications. Ronan and Conor joined our San Francisco program in December 2017 and Acceleprise was the first check into the company. Inscribe then went on to do Y Combinator and subsequently has raised $13M across a seed and Series A round from funds like Uncork Capital, Crosslink Capital and Foundry Group.
tag_to_content.div_21: The next generation of great companies will leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to enhance software and drive more automation across businesses. There will be incredibly large opportunities across the board to solve real business problems leveraging AI and we are excited to work with founders who are working to do just that.
tag_to_content.div_24: The Supply Chain and Logistics markets are measured in the trillions of dollars and they are in the midst of being transformed by technology to meet the increasing expectations of today's consumer. Our Managing Partner was an early (small) angel investor in Flexport and we believe there will continue to be massive opportunities across supply chain and logistics enablement.
tag_to_content.div_26: Sote is building the operating system for trade in Africa. Meka and Felix, two incredibly driven and ambitious founders with a very big vision for how Sote can impact Africa, joined our San Francisco program in January 2020.  We invested across both the accelerator and their seed round. They have since gone on to raise $7.65M across pre-seed and seed funding from funds like Backstage Capital, MaC Venture Capital and Unshackled Ventures.
tag_to_content.strong_9: Kate Alexander, Ram Radhakrishnan & Vishnu Nair
tag_to_content.div_27: Silq is powering global manufacturing with local expertise. They leverage their technology platform to help brands manage sourcing, quality inspections and manufacturing. Ram, Kate and Vishnu all worked together previously at Flexport and when they came to us we knew we wanted to invest in them straight away given their founder-market fit. Forum invested in their seed round alongside RTP Ventures, SV Angel and others, and they quickly went on to raise a $17.6M Series A.
tag_to_content.div_28: Emiel joined our program in Toronto in January 2020. We were the first check into VendorPM. During the program, we saw early signs of product market fit and a founder who showed a relentless drive to build a big business. In August 2020, we co invested in their Seed round led by Bessemer Venture Partners. Less than 9 months later, revenue grew over 10X and they raised a $20M Series A.
tag_to_content.div_29: CoProcure is building a platform that makes it easy for local governments to find and use cooperative contracts for anything they purchase. CoProcure joined our San Francisco program in July 2018 and we were the first check into the company when it was little more than an idea. They have since gone on to raise $22M in Seed and Series A rounds from funds like Leadout Capital, Neo and Forerunner Ventures.
tag_to_content.div_31: As consumers, we increasingly buy things online but so much of B2B purchasing is still done offline through manual processes and/or brokers. We believe so much that the massive spend by businesses across every industry will move to more efficient, digital first experiences and that companies building B2B marketplaces have a big opportunity ahead.

tag_to_content.title: Innovation Forum | A private community for corporate innovation executives
tag_to_content.div_3: A private peer community to make the innovation journey easier.
tag_to_content.p_0: The InnoForum is a private peer community for innovation leaders to connect, discuss new ideas, collaborate, share best practices, support one another and build the future. Members also benefit from access to trend reports, collaborative events, and opportunities to invest in/mentor/pilot startups.
tag_to_content.h2_2: Here’s What Our Members Are Saying
tag_to_content.div_10: "Forum offers insights to new startups that are aiming to solve a problem - that right there is innovative! Being in this circle affords us all the opportunity to discuss those startups, our pain-points at our companies and hear others."
tag_to_content.div_11: –Phil Saglimbene, Director Technology Platforms at NY Power Authority
tag_to_content.div_12: “Great stuff and great exchanges! Lots of energy and ideas moving.  The Innovation forum offers a platform to help find others who have the same needs as myself and my business.”
tag_to_content.div_13: – Sandra Elliot, VP Life Sciences and Innovation at Hackensack Meridian
tag_to_content.div_14: “The advisory board calls that the Innovation Forum offers have helped me immensely in my role as an Innovation leader. I always come away from a discussion having learned something new, and having been inspired to share.”
tag_to_content.div_15: – Suzanne Taylor, VP Innovation Ecosystem and Emerging Technologies at Unisys

tag_to_content.title: Careers
tag_to_content.h1_0: We want YOU...to work with us.
tag_to_content.p_0: Forum Ventures® is the leading early-stage fund, program, and community for B2B SaaS startups based in New York, San Francisco, Toronto, and remote. Founded in 2014, we’re on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible, and more successful for early-stage founders, through pre-seed and seed-stage funding. We provide high-touch  1:1 support, programming, corporate perks and introductions, and an active SaaS community to support you through every step of your building journey.
tag_to_content.p_1: We’re a small team of investors and operators with a passion for helping founders succeed on their journeys, especially those that are traditionally underrepresented.
tag_to_content.div_4: If we don't walk our talk - what are we even here for?
tag_to_content.p_2: We care deeply about building meaningful relationships with our founders. We believe in working together as partners to produce companies that drive impact. We mean it when we say our founders come first.
tag_to_content.p_3: We're not afraid to dream big. We use our strengths to roadmap our goals strategically and with conviction. Setting ambitious goals at Forum also means being flexible and open to feedback - a collective of voices and perspectives drive our ship. We set our sights high and carve a path to reach it.
tag_to_content.p_4: People are the force behind successful companies. Being human means staying in touch with our founders beyond the mechanics of our day-to-day tasks. Openness around the ebbs and flows of life and business keep people at the core of what we do, because let's be honest -machines are for assembly lines.
tag_to_content.p_5: Our core team is a small but mighty group. We are a team of doers and connectors. We are open to any and all ideas. We fail fast and iterate quickly.
tag_to_content.p_6: We are always looking for folks that want to build with us in specific industries and problem areas. We want to chat if you’ve always wanted to be a founder but aren’t sure where to start.
tag_to_content.p_7: We support hiring for the initial team members of the companies that come out of the Forum Studio. If you thrive in the ambiguity and chaos of an early-stage startup, drop us a line.
tag_to_content.h3_6: Join one of our Portfolio Companies
tag_to_content.p_8: Join our talent network to get matched with opportunities from our portfolio.
tag_to_content.p_9: At Forum Ventures®, our mission is to create a space where everyone—no matter their background—can access funding, build their dreams, and push the world forward. Learn why DE&I is important at Forum
